job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-23T06:35:08.000Z", "description": "
Summary
In this role, you will be at the center of a silicon design group responsible for designing and productizing state of the art cellular SoCs. As a cellular system engineer, you will be responsible for architecture, simulation, bringup, and validation of end-to-end cellular systems.


Key Qualifications
Experience in design and bringup of wireless communication systems with experience in cellular systems preferred.

Good understanding of communication theory and signal processing, AGC, beamforming, Tx power control, mitigation of radio impairments, calibration algorithms

Strong technical background in 5G-NR/LTE/UMTS (3G/2G) physical layer and protocols is a plus

Experience with silicon prototyping, emulation systems, and virtual platforms a plus

Hands on experience in bring up of real silicon in lab, ability to efficiently use lab equipment (such as spectrum analyzer, signal generator, power meter, etc).

Good experience with Matlab, Python, and/ C/C++ and efficient analysis and automation scripting

Strong working knowledge of multiple 4G/5G signaling and physical layer test equipment (Keysight/Anritsu/R&S) along with their automation interfaces is a plus


Description
\u2022\tUnderstanding and mapping of systems algorithms and requirements to HW/FW architecture

\u2022\tSimulation based validation of the control flows and algorithms

\u2022\tImplement fixed-point models and perform detailed performance investigation to allow performance sign-off and enable RTL bit-exact development

\u2022\tPre-silicon prototyping and emulation based bringup and validation of the cellular system

\u2022\tBringup of the cellular end-to-end system including characterization and optimization of performance in the lab


Education & Experience
MS or Ph.D. with 5+ Years\u2019 Experience


Role Number: 200204958
